website_summaries.verdict: A durable, long-lasting hammer that delivers wonderful results when used during a variety of drywall projects.
pros: Features a round milled face that is ideal for driving nails
Includes a bevel nail slot designed for easy nail pulling
Offers a sharp blade so you can instantly score drywall
Intended for do-it-yourselfers and professionals alike
cons: Hammer's edge may need to be sharpened prior to initial use

customer_reviews.title: It's an Estwing, You know you can trust it!
customer_reviews.text: Its an Estwing, what really more do you need to know. Durable and will do the job it is intended to do. Like these grips and because of that I typically only will buy Estwing hammers, the new Ultra series looks Awesome hoping to try swinging one of the 15oz black ones soon, thats one slick looking hammer!
customer_reviews.author: Will R

customer_reviews.title: Terrific hammer. As pointed out
customer_reviews.text: Terrific hammer. As pointed out, you will probably want to sharpen the edge as it is dull from the factory. That's not a surprise these days. A few minutes on a bench grinder and you're all set. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Miluzzu

customer_reviews.title: Love the non-wood handle.
customer_reviews.text: Best drywall hammer I have ever owned. The handle is fantastic. Prefer it over wood.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great brand.
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as expected and advertised. Great brand at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: C/J

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: It sure cuts down on the cutting blades in your utility knife. When you don't have a drywall screwgun handy, it leaves the perfect dimples for plaster.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mad

customer_reviews.title: estwing hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good solid hammer. Still have a estwing hammer over 20 yrs old built to last. Is my favorite hammer
customer_reviews.author: glenn mclellan

customer_reviews.title: This only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the edge was too dull to properly score drywall out of the box
customer_reviews.text: A solid American made tool. This only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that the edge was too dull to properly score drywall out of the box. I have to put an edge on it with a file and stone. I know, 99.9999% of the time, you will never use this hammer to do drywall, and this tool is a bit of a throwback to a simpler time.... But the hammer needed a proper edge. Still a great tool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The mother of all hammers!
customer_reviews.text: Strong SINGLE PIECE steel construction with an oversize head and grid pattern imprinted on the head (for drywall). Just the right weight. This is now my go-to hammer for both drywall and everyday jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Tech-Guru

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: The item was just what I wanted. I use this item for driving hubs and grade stakes in my surveying business.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This product contains carcinogenic elements/materials in its manufacture and Estwing ...
customer_reviews.text: This product contains carcinogenic elements/materials in its manufacture and Estwing neglects to state this fact w/in the product description. There's a sticker on this item stating it cannot be sold in California due to Proposition 65.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Professional 's Choice
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to pound nails all day go by a wooden handled tool and save your wrist and elbow from absorbing the vibrations this tool will deliver to your arm but for the professional this is a well made tool. A Professional drywaller screws the drywall on the wall but they overwhelmingly choose this the Estwing hammer because of its versatility as a pry bar and the occasional hammer and hatchet. The 14 oz. Estwing has weight, leverage and balance that just feels right in your hand. Besides a wooden handeled tool would not take the prying abuse these hammers are exposed to on the job.
customer_reviews.author: P. McGinn

customer_reviews.title: So tough it lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: The Estwing hammers are built tough, they last for decades. My drywall hammer was purchased more than 20 years ago and is still as good as new. I don't do drywall every day, only for my own appartment repairs, but if you have to do the job you need the best tools. It's balanced about right, the blade is tough for chopping stuff out of the way, and the face has just the right dimples.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Philosopher

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer ever.
customer_reviews.text: The Estwing is the best hammer that money can buy. It is a little more expensive than most, but the quality is second to none. This hammer will give you many years of good service.
customer_reviews.author: P. Taylor

product_meta.title: Estwing Drywall Hammer - 14 oz Wall Board Tool with Milled Face & Shock Reduction Grip - E3-11
product_meta.description:
Estwing's Solid Steel Milled Face Shingler's Hammer has a fully polished head and handle neck, molded on nylon vinyl grip and a retractable cutting blade. Adjustable for 4", 5", 5-5/8" exposure.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Drywall hammer has a bonded and molded Shock Reduction Grip which offers the uost in both comfort and durability, while reducing vibrations caused by impact. Estwing hammers are the only hammers that can make this claim. The head and handle are forged in one piece and are fully polished. The round face makes for easy nail driving and the blade will score drywall.
feature_bullets: Forged in one piece – The most durable, longest lasting striking tools available
Versatility on the job – the round milled face is perfect for driving nails, the bevel nail slot allows for easy nail pulling. The sharp blade of the hammer will score drywall with ease
Built for the Pro – framers, roofers, carpenters, contractors, tradesman & serious diyer
